page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: The First School in Dagnall.The village school was built in Victorian times to cater for children in the 5 to 11 age range but since a county reorganisation the age range has been 5 to 8. At one time over 50 children attended the school and there were 2 teahers but the numbers have fallen and there are now only 29 children and one teacher.The school has a small outside learner swimming pool built by the fundraising efforts of the parents and the school buildings are used for evening classes.At the age of 8 the children transfer to the Middle School at Edlesborough.
